alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 8:02PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: .Ice and high water is jammed up in front of Fort Yukon, with some ice and water moving through the jam. Water is over the bank and flooding low lying areas of Fort Yukon. As the ice jam shifts, water levels could still rise rapidly and cause flooding to worsen tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Yukon River near Fort Yukon. * WHEN...Until 515 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas in Fort Yukon is occurring now, such as around the Tribal Hall. Water levels could still rise very rapidly and cause flooding to worsen tonight. Water will remain high until the ice jam releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 742 PM AKDT, Ice and high water caused a major flood at Circle on Saturday. This large run of ice and high water started passing through Fort Yukon today. Fort Yukon residents report that late this afternoon ice is jammed up in front of Fort Yukon, with some ice and water moving through the jam. Water is over the bank and flooding low lying areas of Fort Yukon such as around the Tribal Hall. As the ice jam shifts, water levels could still rise rapidly and cause flooding to worsen tonight. - People in Fort Yukon should prepare now to move to high ground at a moments notice. Flooding could still worsen tonight or Monday as the ice jam shifts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Yukon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River at Fort Yukon stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
